intro: Malope ciliata, commonly known as the silky malope, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers with long, slender petals. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Malope ciliata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
